Key Match Events: France won 3-2 against Chile with goals from Fofana (18'), Kolo (25'), and Giroud (72').
Chile's goals were scored by Nunez (6') and Osorio (82').
Pre-Game Insights: Didier Deschamps is expected to make numerous changes to his France side ahead of the match against Chile.
Kylian Mbappe was among the starters against Germany and should keep his place.
Brice Samba had an excellent game in goal against Germany, but Mike Maignan is likely to start against Chile.
The entire back four could change with William Saliba and Ibrahima Konate likely to start as central defenders.
Theo Hernandez could replace his brother Lucas Hernandez at full-back.
Olivier Giroud remains in good form for Milan and could start against Chile.
Young Paris Saint-Germain midfielder Warren Zaire-Emery may keep his place in the starting lineup.
Antoine Griezmann is absent due to injury, ending his 84-game streak with the French side.
Kingsley Coman and Boubacar Kamara are also absent with injury.
